alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 7:39PM EST until January 13 at 5:53AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River Near Stony Creek affecting Sussex County. Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Rawlings affecting Dinwiddie and Brunswick Counties. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meherrin River at Lawrenceville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 25.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM EST Thursday was 25.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.9 feet on 05/18/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 745 AM EST.
